arm_group.description: 2 doses, 3 and 1 hours, prior surgery (group B, 35 cases).
intra-vaginal single dose of 400 microgram Misoprostol 1 hour pre-operatively (group A, 34 cases)

brief_summary.textblock:
Introduction: The study aimed to investigate the effectiveness of a single versus double
      dose of Prostaglandin E2 "Misoprostol, 400 microgram" during myomectomy for multiple uterine
      fibroids. This was a prospective randomized controlled trial comprised of 69 patients with
      multiple myomas undergoing myomectomy. Patients randomly allocated to either an
      intra-vaginal single dose of 400 microgram Misoprostol 1 hour pre-operatively (group A, 34
      cases) or 2 doses, 3 and 1 hours, prior surgery (group B, 35 cases). Operation time, intra
      and post-operative blood loss, hemoglobin concentration, blood pressure and body's
      temperature were estimated and compared in both groups.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single Versus Double Dose Intra-vaginal Prostaglandin E2 "Misoprostol" Prior Abdominal Myomectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients had symptomatic multiple uterine fibroids (abnormal vaginal bleeding,
             lower abdominal dull aching pain and pelvic heaviness, subfertility or recurrent
             abortion)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  hypertension, cardiac and pulmonary disease, chronic endocrine or metabolic diseases
             such as diabetes, obesity (body mass index >30 kg/m2), all cases of single myoma and
             those known to be allergic to prostaglandin preparations.

clinical_study.official_title: Single Versus Double Dose Intra-vaginal Prostaglandin E2 "Misoprostol" Prior Abdominal Myomectomy: A Randomized Controlled Study

primary_outcome.description: The time from start till end of surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: from skin to skin in minutes

primary_outcome.description: collected soaked towels and sucked blood
